Name: 3M
Commitment: 3M's target is to source 100% renewable electricity for its global operations by 2050.
Explanation: 3M is a global manufacturing and technology company applying science in collaborative ways to improve lives. The company is committed to source 100% renewable electricity for its global operations by 2050, with an interim goal of 50% by 2025. This is part of 3M’s strategic focus on science for climate with the aspiration to innovate to decarbonise industry, accelerate global climate solutions and improve the company’s environmental footprint.

Name: Adobe
Commitment: Adobe aims to be 100% powered by renewable electricity by 2035.
Explanation: Adobe is a multinational software company based in the US. The company is committed to powering its operations and the digital delivery of its products entirely with renewable electricity by 2035 as one of five ambitious goals that will contribute to a low-carbon, sustainable future.  Learn more

Name: Airbnb
Commitment: Airbnb has committed to using 100% renewable electricity by 2021.
Explanation: Airbnb was born in 2008 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to 4 million Hosts who have welcomed over 800 million guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Airbnb is committed to using 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2021, and is working with their community of Hosts to encourage the adoption of renewable electricity for their homes.

Name: ALTANA
Commitment: The ALTANA Group will be carbon neutral by 2025. They will achieve 100% renewable electricity in accordance with RE100’s technical criteria by 2040.
Explanation: The ALTANA Group develops and manufactures high-quality, innovative specialty chemical products. The Group has 48 production facilities and 65 service and research laboratories worldwide. The company is on target to achieve carbon neutrality in 2025 and has already achieved 96% renewable electricity across its entire global operations. The remaining 4% refers to energy efficient Combined Heat & Power Plants using natural gas. Offsets will be used to neutralize this until it will be renewable in accordance with RE100’s technical criteria, by 2040 at the latest.

Name: Anheuser-Busch InBev
Commitment: AB InBev has set a target to secure 100% of its purchased electricity from renewable sources by 2025.
Explanation: Anheuser-Busch InBev is the world’s largest brewer, based in Leuven, Belgium. Its diverse portfolio of well over 400 beer brands leverages the collective strengths of 200,000 employees in 50 countries. AB InBev has committed to transitioning its global operations to 100% renewable electricity and has set a target to secure all of its purchased electricity from renewable sources by 2025.  Learn more

Name: Apple
Commitment: In April 2018, Apple announced achieving 100% renewable electricity, powering its global facilities across 43 countries.
Explanation: Apple lead the world in innovation with iPhone, iPad, Mac, Apple Watch and Apple TV. In April 2018, Apple announced that it had achieved 100% renewable electricity, powering its global facilities across 43 countries. Apple is also helping its manufacturing partners to lower its carbon footprint, working with them to install more than 4 gigawatts of new clean energy worldwide by 2020.

Name: AstraZeneca
Commitment: AstraZeneca has a goal to source 100% renewable electricity globally by 2025
Explanation: AstraZeneca is a global, science-led biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines. The company is committed to doing its 'fair share' to protect the planet and to keeping employees safe and healthy. AstraZeneca has a goal to source 100% renewable electricity globally by 2025, with an interim target of 100% in Europe and the US by 2020.

Name: Barclays
Commitment: Barclays has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: With over 325 years of history and expertise in banking, Barclays operates in over 40 countries and employs approximately 83,500 people. Barclays moves, lends, invests and protects money for customers and clients worldwide. Barclays has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2030 and 90% by 2025.

Name: BayWa
Commitment: BayWa has set a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity globally by 2020.
Explanation: BayWa AG is a trading and services Group operating in Agriculture, Energy, Building Materials, Innovation and Digitalisation. Headquartered in Munich, the company is active on every continent of the world, and has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity globally by 2020.

Name: BT

Explanation: BT’s purpose is to use the power of communications to make a better world. As one of the world’s leading communications services companies, BT serves the needs of customers in the UK and in more than 170 countries worldwide. BT has put sustainability at the heart of its business, and its 2020 goals include ambitions to procure 100% renewable electricity globally.

Name: Canary Wharf Group
Commitment: Canary Wharf Group has procured 100% renewable electricity for all of its managed areas and construction projects since 2012.
Explanation: Canary Wharf Group is a fully integrated property development, investment, and management group. The Group is on a zero-carbon trajectory, and since 2012 has procured 100% renewable electricity for all of its managed areas and construction projects. Based in London and fully committed to a more sustainable future, the Group aims to inspire positive impact through making great places.

Name: Capital One

Explanation: Capital One is a diversified bank that offers a broad array of financial products and services to consumers, small businesses and commercial clients. In 2017, Capital One reached its goal of achieving 100% renewable electricity across its global operations.

Name: CHANEL

Coty has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2030.

Name: Danone
Commitment: Danone has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2030.

Name: Decathlon

Explanation: Decathlon is a leading sports retailer in Europe and around the globe, with presence in over 50 countries. Decathlon joined RE100 with a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity for its global operations by 2026.

Name: Deloitte
Commitment: Deloitte has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. Name: Delta Electronics

Envision is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2025.

Name: Facebook

Name: First Solar

First Solar has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2028, with an interim goal of transitioning its facilities in the United States, where it is headquartered and operates the Western Hemisphere’s largest solar manufacturing footprint, to carbon-free electricity by 2026.

Name: Fujitsu

Name: General Motors

This goal, along with the pursuit of electrified vehicles and responsible manufacturing, is part of the company’s approach to strengthening its business, improving communities and addressing climate change.

Name: Goldman Sachs Group
Commitment: Goldman Sachs Group has set a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

It has set a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Google
Commitment: Google announced achieving its goal of sourcing 100% renewable electricity globally in 2017.

Name: H&M

Name: Iron Mountain Incorporated

Name: Macquarie Group Limited

Name: Microsoft

Name: Nexans

Name: NIKE

Explanation: NIKE, Inc. is the world's leading designer, marketer and distributor of authentic athletic footwear, apparel, equipment and accessories for a wide variety of sports and fitness activities. NIKE, Inc. is committed to reaching 100% renewable electricity by 2025.

Name: Nissin Foods Holdings

Explanation: Nissin Foods Holdings is a Japanese food company that produces instant noodles and convenience food. Name: Novartis

Explanation: Novartis is a leading global medicines company that uses innovative science and digital technologies to create transformative treatments in areas of great medical need. Novartis has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2025.

Name: PwC

Name: Sanofi

Name: SK Hynix

Name: SK Telecom

Name: Sky plc

Name: T-Mobile US, Inc.

Name: Allianz Group

Name: Amalgamated Bank
Commitment: Amalgamated Bank achieved its goal to source 100% renewable electricity in 2017.
Explanation: Amalgamated Bank, as part of its commitment to values-based banking, joined RE100 to call on the rest of the industry to follow its lead and take significant steps to proactively address climate risk and reduce carbon pollution. Amalgamated Bank achieved its goal to source 100% renewable electricity in 2017.

Name: American Express
Commitment: American Express announced that it had reached its 100% renewable electricity target in 2018.
Explanation: American Express is a globally integrated payments company, providing customers with access to products, insights and experiences that enrich lives and build business success. American Express has publicly stated its commitment to continuing to power its operations with renewable electricity after announcing reaching the 100% milestone in 2018.

Name: Amorepacific
Commitment: Amorepacific has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Amorepacific is a South Korean beauty company operating over 20 beauty, personal care, and health care brands. The company commits to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2030.

Name: Anthem, Inc.
Commitment: Anthem, Inc. has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: Anthem, Inc. is a leading health benefits company dedicated to improving lives and communities and making healthcare simpler. The company recognises the link between environmental health and the health of consumers and communities and is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2025.

Name: ANZ
Commitment: ANZ has committed to powering 100% of its global operations with renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: ANZ is an Australian multinational banking and financial services company headquartered in Melbourne, serving more than 5 million customers and operating in its primary markets of Australia and New Zealand, as well as Asia, the Pacific, UK/Europe and the US. ANZ has committed to powering 100% of its global operations with renewable electricity by 2025.

Name: Arm
Commitment: Arm has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2023.
Explanation: Arm is a semiconductor and software design company whose advanced intellectual property products have shipped in more than 180 billion chips, powering everything from tiny sensors to the world’s most powerful supercomputer. Arm has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2023.

Name: Asahi Group Holdings, Ltd.
Commitment: Asahi Group Holdings, Ltd. has committed to achieving 100% renewable electricity by 2050.
Explanation: Asahi Group Holdings, Ltd. Is a Japanese global beer, wine, spirits, soft drinks and food business group. The company commits to sourcing 100% renewable electricity for its global operations by 2050.

Name: Asahi Kasei Homes Corp.
Commitment: Asahi Kasei Homes aims to procure 100% of its electricity from renewable energy by 2038.
Explanation: Asahi Kasei Homes Corp. is a leading housing manufacturer in Japan, providing long-life detached houses and apartment housings (“HEBEL HAUS”) that take the environment and energy into consideration throughout the life cycle of housing. In order to promote the use of renewable energy and realise a decarbonised society, Asahi Kasei Homes aims to procure 100% of its electricity from renewable energy by 2038.

Name: ASICS
Commitment: ASICS has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2050.
Explanation: ASICS is a Japanese company which produces sports goods such as footwear, apparel and equipment designed for a range of sports. ASICS has set a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2050.

Name: ASKUL Corporation
Commitment: ASKUL Corporation is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: ASKUL Corporation is a Japanese e-commerce company offering a wide variety of products to households and companies across Japan. The company is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030, with an interim goal of 80% by 2025.

Name: Asset Management One Co.
Commitment: Asset Management One has set a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2050 for a sustainable future.
Explanation: Asset Management One Co., Ltd. is one of the largest asset managers in Asia, providing a broad and diverse range of investment solutions to institutional and retail clients. Asset Management One has set a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2050 for a sustainable future.

Name: Atlassian
Commitment: Atlassian achieved 100% renewable electricity across its operations in 2020.
Explanation: Atlassian is an Australian enterprise software company that develops products for improving software development, project management, collaboration, and code quality. Atlassian achieved its goal to source 100% renewable electricity in 2020, five years ahead of schedule.

Name: Aurora Organic Dairy
Commitment: Aurora Organic Dairy has a goal to source 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Aurora Organic Dairy is a leading producer and processor of high-quality organic milk and butter for retail store brands. The company has a goal to source 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Autodesk
Commitment: Autodesk achieved its goal to source 100% renewable power in 2016 – four years ahead of schedule.
Explanation: Autodesk is an American multinational software corporation that achieved its goal to source 100% renewable power in 2016 – four years ahead of schedule.

Name: Aviva
Commitment: Aviva has a target to procure 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2025.
Explanation: Aviva is a British multinational insurance company providing savings, retirement, insurance, health and asset management products and services. The company is working to increase the amount of renewable electricity they purchase for its operations globally and have a goal to procure 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2025.

Name: AXA
Commitment: AXA has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: AXA is a French insurance company targeting 100% renewable electricity by 2025. Operating in more than 60 countries with diverse energy markets, AXA intends to achieve this target by using a mix of approaches, notably buying electricity directly from providers and compensating for non-renewable electricity.

Name: Bank Australia
Commitment: Bank Australia announced it had achieved their 100% target a year early, in 2019.
Explanation: Bank Australia is a customer-owned bank that believes in the importance of using their customers’ money in responsible ways. Bank Australia announced it had achieved their 100% target a year early, in 2019.

Name: Bank of America
Commitment: Bank of America has set a goal to become carbon neutral and purchase 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Bank of America is one of the world’s leading financial institutions, offering a full range of banking, investing and other financial and risk management products and services. As part of its commitment to grow its business responsibly, the bank has set a goal to become carbon neutral and purchase 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Bankia
Commitment: Since 2013, Bankia has been using, in all its buildings and offices, 100% renewable electricity with certificates of Guarantees of Origin.
Explanation: Bankia is a Spanish bank with a universal banking business model based on multi-channel management. Since 2013, Bankia has been using, in all its buildings and offices, 100% renewable electricity with certificates of Guarantees of Origin, and the bank plans to continue this approach in future.

Name: BBVA
Commitment: BBVA has committed to source 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2030.
Explanation: BBVA is a global financial group that operates a customer-focused retail business model, offering clients a comprehensive range of financial and non-financial products and services around the world. The company has committed to source 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2030, with interim targets of 48% by 2020 and 70% by 2025.

Name: BESTSELLER
Commitment: BESTSELLER joined RE100 with a commitment to power its owned and operated buildings globally with 100% renewable electricity by 2021.
Explanation: BESTSELLER is an international family-owned fashion company founded in Denmark in 1975 that provides clothing and accessories for women, men, teenagers and children through 17 brands. BESTSELLER joined RE100 with a commitment to power its owned and operated buildings globally with 100% renewable electricity by 2021.

Name: Bingo Industries
Commitment: Bingo Industries has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: Bingo Industries is an Australian fully integrated recycling and resource management company that provides solutions across the entire waste management supply chain. It has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2025.

Name: Biogen
Commitment: Biogen has reached its 100% goal, buying renewable energy certificates equal to all of its electricity across its value chain.
Explanation: Biogen is an international biotechnology company based in the US, developing and delivering innovative therapies for those living with serious neurological, autoimmune and rare diseases. The company has been working for years to drive operational efficiencies and has reached its 100% goal, buying renewable energy certificates equal to all of its electricity across its value chain. Biogen is now also working to engage its supply chain and source renewable power more directly.

Name: Bloomberg LP
Commitment: Bloomberg LP has a goal to source 100% renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: Bloomberg LP, through its unique technology, deliver business and financial information, news and insight around the world. The company is based in the US and is committed to renewable energy and sustainable business practices, with a goal to source 100% renewable electricity by 2025.

Name: BMW Group
Commitment: BMW is committed to procuring 100% of electricity from renewable sources for its operations by 2050.
Explanation: BMW Group is a German automobile, motorcycle and engine manufacturer with a global market. Aspiring to be the most sustainable company in the automotive industry, BMW is intensifying its efforts to produce more electricity in-house and source locally generated renewable energy. BMW is committed to procuring 100% of electricity from renewable sources for its operations by 2050 and has an interim target to source more than two thirds of its electricity from renewables by 2020.

Name: Bozzuto Group
Commitment: Bozzuto Group has set a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity for its entire global operations by 2040.
Explanation: The Bozzuto Group is an experience-focused real estate company with expertise in homebuilding, multifamily development, construction and management. Bozzuto currently manages 70,000 apartments and 2 million square feet of retail space along the East Coast, in Miami, Boston and the Northeast, and Chicago. The company has set a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity for its entire global operations by 2040.

Name: Brenntag
Commitment: Brenntag has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: Brenntag is a global market leader in chemicals and ingredients distribution. The company is headquartered in Essen, Germany, and operates a network of more than 670 sites in 77 countries worldwide. Brenntag commits to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2025.

Name: British Land
Commitment: British Land has set a goal to use 100% renewable electricity to light and power all of its shopping destinations and office campuses by 2016.
Explanation: British Land is a London-based property investment company focused on managing, financing and developing prime commercial property. The company has set a goal to use 100% renewable electricity to light and power all of its shopping destinations and office campuses by 2016. That year, British Land completed the largest installation of solar PV at a UK shopping centre.

Name: BROAD Group
Commitment: BROAD Group has a commitment to source 100% renewable electricity for of all its operations by 2045.
Explanation: BROAD Group is a Chinese developer of air conditioning units, combined cooling-heating-power projects, fresh air systems, and factory-made sustainable buildings, with products in more than 80 countries. The company has a commitment to source 100% renewable electricity for of all its operations by 2045.

Name: Burberry
Commitment: Burberry is aiming to procure 100% of electricity from renewable resources to power its whole business by 2022.
Explanation: Burberry is a global luxury fashion brand with a distinctive British identity, founded in 1856. As a global retailer and manufacturer, Burberry employs over 10,000 people and have over 400 retail locations worldwide. Burberry is aiming to procure 100% of electricity from renewable resources to power its whole business by 2022.

Name: CaixaBank
Commitment: CaixaBank has a goal of sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2040.
Explanation: CaixaBank is Spain’s leading bank by market share, operating in retail banking and insurance, while also holding investments in international banks and prominent services companies. The bank has a goal of sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2040 – and is already almost there.

Name: Califia Farms
Commitment: Califia Farms has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Califia Farms is a leading provider of nutmilks, ready-to-drink coffees, juices and creamers, all of which are 100% plant-based, non-GMO, carrageenan-free, gluten-free, vegan and made with no artificial ingredients. The company committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Capgemini
Commitment: Capgemini has committed to source 100% renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: Capgemini is a global consulting, digital transformation, technology, and engineering services company. Capgemini has committed to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2025.

Name: Charles River Laboratories
Commitment: Charles River Laboratories has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Charles River Laboratories provides products and services to help expedite the discovery, early-stage development and safe manufacture of novel drugs and therapeutics. The company has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2030.

Name: Citi
Commitment: Citi has set a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Citi is the leading global bank, with approximately 200 million customer accounts and business in more than 160 countries, and a mission to responsibly provide financial services that enable growth and economic progress. The bank has set a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: City of London Corporation
Commitment: City of London Corporation has been running on 100% renewable electricity since October 2018.
Explanation: The City Corporation is the governing body of the Square Mile dedicated to a vibrant and thriving City, supporting a diverse and sustainable London within a globally successful UK. The organisation has been running on 100% renewable electricity since October 2018.

Name: Clif Bar & Company
Commitment: Clif Bar has been purchasing renewable electricity certificates equivalent to 100% of its total operations and is now exploring more direct ways of sourcing renewable energy.
Explanation: Clif Bar & Company is an American maker of organic foods and drinks, committed to 100% renewable power. The company has been purchasing renewable electricity certificates equivalent to 100% of its total operations and is now exploring more direct ways of sourcing renewable energy.

Name: Coca-Cola European Partners
Commitment: Coca-Cola European partners has committed to power all of its operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Coca-Cola European Partners manufactures, markets and distributes Coca-Cola products in Western Europe. The company has committed to power all of its operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Colruyt Group
Commitment: Colruyt Group has already met its goal of sourcing 100% renewable electricity, and now it aims to achieve 100% self-produced renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Colruyt Group is a Belgian retail corporation, consisting of a family of sister companies including the Colruyt stores. The group employs over 28,000 people. Colruyt Group has put the environment at the heart of its business model by generating renewable energy. Name: Commerzbank
Commitment: Commerzbank has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2019.
Explanation: Commerzbank sees climate change as a global challenge and recognises that decisive action from the finance sector is required to address it. The company has designed a climate change strategy that aligns existing activities with its vision for a low carbon future. It set a goal to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2019.

Name: Commonwealth Bank of Australia
Commitment: Commonwealth Bank of Australia has a target to power its operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA) is one of Australia’s leading financial services providers with operations across Australia, New Zealand and abroad. It joined RE100 with a commitment to power its operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2030.

Name: Continental
Commitment: The company commits to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across it’s entire global operations by 2040.
Explanation: Continental, based in Germany, develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and goods. The company commits to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across it’s entire global operations by 2040.

Name: Coop Sapporo
Commitment: Coop Sapporo has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity across its operations by 2040.
Explanation: Coop Sapporo owns a chain of grocery stores for its members in Japan, as well as operating a food delivery service. The company has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity across its operations by 2040, with an interim target of 60% by 2030.

Name: Corbion
Commitment: Corbion aims to power its global operations with 100% renewable power by 2030.
Explanation: Corbion is a Dutch biotechnology company. It is the global market leader in lactic acid and lactic acid derivatives, and a leader in functional blends containing enzymes, emulsifiers, minerals, and vitamins. Corbion aims to power its global operations with 100% renewable power by 2030, with an interim target to reach at least 50% of this goal by 2020.

Name: Crédit Agricole Group
Commitment: Crédit Agricole Group is sourcing 100% renewable electricity in France.
Explanation: Crédit Agricole Group is one of the largest banking groups in Europe, and the biggest contributor of loans and advances to the French economy. Crédit Agricole Group is sourcing 100% renewable electricity in France.

Name: Credit Suisse
Commitment: Credit Suisse is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2025.
Explanation: Credit Suisse is one of the world’s leading banks with operations in around 50 countries. It is committed to delivering financial expertise to corporate, institutional and government clients and ultra-high-net-worth individuals. Credit Suisse has a broad understanding of its duties as a financial services provider, member of society, and employer which is also reflected in its efforts to protect the environment. The bank is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2025.

Name: Crown Estate
Commitment: Crown Estate has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2022.
Explanation: The Crown Estate is a real estate business specialising in commercial property in central London, prime regional retail and offshore wind. Name: Crown Holdings, Inc.
Commitment: Crown has a target to use 100% renewable electricity globally by 2050.

Crown has a target to use 100% renewable electricity globally by 2050, 90% by 2040 and 60% by 2030.

Name: Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co.

Explanation: Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co. Ltd. is one of the largest life insurers in Japan. The company has set a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2050.

Name: Daiichi Sankyo

Explanation: Daiichi Sankyo Group is dedicated to the creation and supply of innovative pharmaceutical therapies. Name: Daito Trust Construction Co.
Commitment: Daito Trust Construction Co. has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2040.
Explanation: Daito Trust Construction Co., Ltd. is a construction and real estate engaged company, supplying and managing the largest number of rental housing units in Japan. The company has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2040.

Name: Daiwa House Group
Commitment: Daiwa House Group has set a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity for its entire global operations by 2040.
Explanation: Daiwa House Group is one of Japan’s largest homebuilders, specializing in building, managing, and helping to maintain single-family houses, condominiums, and rental housing. The company has set a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity for its entire global operations by 2040.

Name: Dalmia Cement
Commitment: Dalmia Cement has set a goal to power all its operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Dalmia Cement is a leading supplier of cement and the flagship company of Indian conglomerate Dalmia Bharat Group. Name: Danfoss
Commitment: Danfoss is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030 across its global operations.
Explanation: Danfoss, headquartered in Denmark, engineers and manufactures energy efficient technologies to empower smart communities and industries to create healthier and more comfortable climates in buildings and homes and to supply more food with less waste. The company is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030 across its global operations.

Name: Danske Bank Group
Commitment: Danske Bank became 100% powered by renewable electricity in 2015.
Explanation: Danske Bank Group is a Nordic universal bank with more than 3.4 million clients. The bank acknowledges that the financial sector plays an important role in supporting the transition to a low-carbon economy and, since 2009, it has worked to minimize the negative environmental impact of its business operations. In 2015, 2009, it has worked to minimise the negative environmental impact of its business operations. In 2015, Danske Bank became 100% powered by renewable electricity.

Name: DBS Bank Ltd
Commitment: DBS has set an interim goal of transferring its Singapore operations to renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: DBS Bank Ltd is a leading financial services group in Asia committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity . The bank has set an interim goal of transferring its Singapore operations to renewable electricity by 2030, and aims to subsequently extend this to its global operations.

Name: DEKRA
Commitment: DEKRA has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2025.
Explanation: DEKRA is a global testing, inspection and certification company with a focus on safety. It has a broad service portfolio with qualified and independent expert services that range from vehicle inspection and expert appraisals to claims services, industrial and building inspections, product testing, audits, sustainability assurance, and safety consultancy. DEKRA has set a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2025.

Name: Dell Technologies
Commitment: Dell Technologies has set a goal to source 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2040.
Explanation: Dell Technologies is a global technology company helping organisations and individuals build their digital future and transform how they work, live, and play. Based in the US, the company has set a goal to source 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2040, and an interim goal of 75% by 2030.

Name: Dentsu International
Commitment: Dentsu International achieved 100% renewable electricity across its global operations where markets allow in 2020.
Explanation: Dentsu International achieved its 2020 target to source 100% renewable electricity across its worldwide operations where markets allow. The UK-based company recognises that de-coupling carbon from growth will allow it to become resilient to resource scarcity and price fluctuations.

Name: Derwent London
Commitment: Derwent has already reached its target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Derwent London is the largest central London focused Real Estate Investment Trust (REIT) with an investment portfolio of 5.4 million square feet, worth £5.2 billion. Derwent has already reached its target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Deutsche Telekom
Commitment: Deutsche Telekom has committed to use 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2021.
Explanation: Deutsche Telekom is one of the world's leading integrated telecommunications companies, present in more than 50 countries, with some 178 million mobile customers, 28 million fixed-network lines, and 20 million broadband lines (as of 31 December 2018). The company believes that economic, social and ecological perspectives can be reconciled, and that sustainability must underpin its business activities. It has committed to use 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2021.

Name: Dexus
Commitment: Dexus has committed to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire operations by 2030.
Explanation: Dexus is a leading Australian real estate group that owns, manages and creates thriving workplaces across the office, industrial, retail and healthcare property sectors. Dexus properties are located in key Australian central business districts, regional communities and urban logistics hubs. Dexus has committed to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire operations by 2030.

Name: Diageo
Commitment: Diageo has committed to powering its global operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Diageo is a global leader in beverage alcohol with a wide collection of brands across spirits and beer including Johnnie Walker, Smirnoff and Guinness. To date, the company has focused largely on the use of renewables for heat, which accounts for most of its energy use. Now, Diageo is increasing its commitment to renewable electricity, and has committed to powering its global operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2030, with an interim target of 50% by 2020 – setting a positive example to its supply chains.

Name: Diamond Electric Holdings
Commitment: Diamond Electric Holdings has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2050.
Explanation: Diamond Electric Holdings is a Japanese company that is mainly involved in the manufacture and sale of automotive equipment and electronic equipment. It has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2050.

Name: DNB
Commitment: Joined RE100 with a target to be powered by local renewable electricity certificates by 2020.
Explanation: DNB is Norway’s largest financial services group. It already purchases renewable electricity certificates equivalent to 100% of the business’ electricity consumption, and joined RE100 with a target to be powered by local renewable electricity certificates by 2020.

Name: eBay
Commitment: eBay has committed to 100% renewable energy in its electricity supply by 2025 at its data centers and offices.
Explanation: eBay is a multinational e-trading company that connects millions of buyers and sellers around the world – aiming to create a more sustainable form of commerce. eBay has committed to 100% renewable energy in its electricity supply by 2025 at its data centers and offices.

Name: Ecolab Inc.
Commitment: Ecolab Inc. has committed to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2030.
Explanation: Ecolab Inc., is a global provider of water, hygiene and infection preventions solutions and services. It helps to advance food safety, maintain clean and safe environments, optimize water and energy use, and improve operational efficiencies and sustainability in the food, healthcare, hospitality and industrial markets in more than 170 countries around the world. The company has committed to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2030.

Name: Elion
Commitment: Elion has committed to source 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Elion is one of China’s top 100 private enterprises that puts managing natural sources at the heart of its business model. The company has committed to source 100% renewable electricity by 2030.

Name: Elopak
Commitment: Elopak achieved its target to use 100% renewable electricity in 2016.
Explanation: Elopak is an international supplier of paper-based packaging solutions for liquid food, and was the first packaging and first Norwegian company to join RE100. The company achieved its target to use 100% renewable electricity in 2016.

Name: Envipro Holdings Inc.
Commitment: Envipro Holdings has committed to source 100% renewable electricity for all its operations by 2050.
Explanation: Envipro Holdings Inc. is a Japanese recycling business working with building waste, precious metal recycling, accumulator batteries as well as plastic recycling. Envipro Holdings has committed to source 100% renewable electricity for all its operations by 2050.

Name: Epson
Commitment: Epson has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2023.
Explanation: Epson is a Japanese electronics company and one of the world's leading manufacturers of printers for office, home, commerce and industry, and with a world leading presence in robotics and projectors. The company has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2023.

Name: Equinix
Commitment: Equinix achieved its interim goal of sourcing 50% renewable electricity (against a 2015 baseline) in 2016.
Explanation: Equinix is a global interconnection and data centre provider, committed to using 100% power across its global operations. The company achieved its interim goal of sourcing 50% renewable electricity (against a 2015 baseline) in 2016, a year ahead of schedule.

Name: Estée Lauder Companies
Commitment: The Estée Lauder Companies has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity globally by 2020.
Explanation: The Estée Lauder Companies is one of the world’s leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance and hair care products with a diverse portfolio of brands sold in 150 countries. The company has a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity globally by 2020.

Name: Etsy
Commitment: Etsy is committed to powering its operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods, including handcrafted pieces and vintage treasures. Etsy is committed to powering its operations with 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: European Metal Recycling
Commitment: European Metal Recycling has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: European Metal Recycling is a global scrap metal company recycling metal from a range of sources including industry, construction and consumer products. It has set a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2030.

Name: FIA Formula E
Commitment: Formula E set a goal to achieve 100% renewable power for all its operations by 2020.
Explanation: FIA Formula E is the first electric single-seater championship, showcasing that electric vehicles can be fast, fun and safe. Its cars run on 100% renewable power. The success of the championship is helping to change the image of electric vehicles and demonstrate that they are the vehicles of the future. Formula E set a goal to achieve 100% renewable power for all its operations by 2020.

Name: Fifth Third Bancorp
Commitment: Fifth Third Bancorp has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2022.
Explanation: Fifth Third Bancorp is a diversified financial services company headquartered in Ohio, US. Fifth Third operates four main businesses: Commercial Banking, Branch Banking, Consumer Lending and Wealth & Asset Management, and is among the largest money managers in the Midwest. The company set a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2022. In March 2018, Fifth Third announced a Virtual PPA equivalent to 100% of its consumption from a new solar project.

Name: Firmenich
Commitment: Firmenich had switched to renewable electricity in all markets where currently possible to source renewables locally by February 2020.
Explanation: Firmenich is the world's largest privately-owned fragrance & flavour company. Conducting business in a way that protects and promotes the environment is paramount for Firmenich. By February 2020, the company had switched to renewable electricity in all markets where is it currently possible to source renewables locally, in accordance with strict RE100 technical criteria. The remaining consumption was covered in other markets and will be covered locally when options become available. This is a fundamental step on the company’s journey to ultimately become carbon neutral.

Name: Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer
Commitment: Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer has a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2030.
Explanation: Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer is a global law firm with a long history of advising leading national and multinational corporations and financial institutions. The firm has more than 2,800 lawyers and other legal professionals who deliver global results from 28 offices worldwide. The firm has a target to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2030.

Name: FUJIFILM Holdings Corporation
Commitment: FUJIFILM Holdings Corporation has a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity globally by 2050.
Explanation: FUJIFILM Holdings Corporation brings cutting edge solutions to a broad range of global industries. Its proprietary core technologies contribute to healthcare, graphic systems, highly functional materials, optical devices, digital imaging and document products. The company has a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity globally by 2050, which will include renovating in-house co-generation systems to zero-carbon renewable options.

Explanation: Delta is a global provider of power and thermal management solutions headquartered in Taiwan. As an energy-saving solutions provider with core competencies in power electronics and automation, Delta's business categories include Power Electronics, Automation, and Infrastructure. The company has a target to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2030.

Name: Envision
Commitment: Envision is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2025.

Headquartered in Shanghai, Envision has regional offices across Asia, Europe, North and South Americas. Envision is committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2025.

Name: Facebook
Commitment: Facebook has a goal to run its entire operations on 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Founded in 2004, Facebook’s mission is to give people the power to share and make the world more open and connected. The company is committed to powering connectivity with the smallest footprint possible, and set a goal of reaching 50% clean and renewable energy in its electricity supply mix for its data centers in 2018, which it achieved a year early. Facebook has a goal to run its entire operations on 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: First Solar
Commitment: First Solar has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2028.

It is a leading provider of comprehensive PV solar solutions with more than 25-gigawatts of modules shipped to over 45 countries worldwide. First Solar has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity across its global operations by 2028, with an interim goal of transitioning its facilities in the United States, where it is headquartered and operates the Western Hemisphere’s largest solar manufacturing footprint, to carbon-free electricity by 2026.

Name: Fujitsu
Commitment: Fujitsu has set a target to source 100% renewable electricity by 2050.

Name: General Motors
Commitment: General Motors has plans to meet the electricity needs of all its global facilities with 100% renewable sources by 2040.
Explanation: General Motors is a global automobile manufacturer that plans to meet the electricity needs of all its global facilities with 100% renewable sources by 2040. GM also plans to meet its US demand with renewable electricity by 2030. This goal, along with the pursuit of electrified vehicles and responsible manufacturing, is part of the company’s approach to strengthening its business, improving communities and addressing climate change.

Name: Goldman Sachs Group
Commitment: Goldman Sachs Group has set a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

It has set a target of sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Google
Commitment: Google announced achieving its goal of sourcing 100% renewable electricity globally in 2017.

Alongside Swiss Re, Ingka Group is a founding partner of the RE100 initiative.  Learn more

ANZ has committed to powering 100% of its global operations with renewable electricity by 2025.

Name: Arm
Commitment: Arm has committed to sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2023.

Name: ASICS

Name: ASKUL Corporation

Name: Asset Management One Co.

Explanation: Asset Management One Co., Ltd. is one of the largest asset managers in Asia, providing a broad and diverse range of investment solutions to institutional and retail clients. Asset Management One has set a target to achieve 100% renewable electricity by 2050 for a sustainable future.

Name: Atlassian

Name: Aurora Organic Dairy
Commitment: Aurora Organic Dairy has a goal to source 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Autodesk
Commitment: Autodesk achieved its goal to source 100% renewable power in 2016 – four years ahead of schedule.
Explanation: Autodesk is an American multinational software corporation that achieved its goal to source 100% renewable power in 2016 – four years ahead of schedule.

Name: Aviva

Explanation: Aviva is a British multinational insurance company providing savings, retirement, insurance, health and asset management products and services. Explanation: AXA is a French insurance company targeting 100% renewable electricity by 2025. Name: Bank Australia
Commitment: Bank Australia announced it had achieved their 100% target a year early, in 2019.
Explanation: Bank Australia is a customer-owned bank that believes in the importance of using their customers’ money in responsible ways. Bank Australia announced it had achieved their 100% target a year early, in 2019.

Name: Bank of America
Commitment: Bank of America has set a goal to become carbon neutral and purchase 100% renewable electricity by 2020.
Explanation: Bank of America is one of the world’s leading financial institutions, offering a full range of banking, investing and other financial and risk management products and services. As part of its commitment to grow its business responsibly, the bank has set a goal to become carbon neutral and purchase 100% renewable electricity by 2020.

Name: Bankia
Commitment: Since 2013, Bankia has been using, in all its buildings and offices, 100% renewable electricity with certificates of Guarantees of Origin.
Explanation: Bankia is a Spanish bank with a universal banking business model based on multi-channel management. Since 2013, Bankia has been using, in all its buildings and offices, 100% renewable electricity with certificates of Guarantees of Origin, and the bank plans to continue this approach in future.

Name: BBVA
Commitment: BBVA has committed to source 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2030.
Explanation: BBVA is a global financial group that operates a customer-focused retail business model, offering clients a comprehensive range of financial and non-financial products and services around the world. The company has committed to source 100% of its electricity from renewable sources by 2030, with interim targets of 48% by 2020 and 70% by 2025.

Name: BESTSELLER
Commitment: BESTSELLER joined RE100 with a commitment to power its owned and operated buildings globally with 100% renewable electricity by 2021.

Name: Bingo Industries

Name: Biogen

The company has been working for years to drive operational efficiencies and has reached its 100% goal, buying renewable energy certificates equal to all of its electricity across its value chain. Biogen is now also working to engage its supply chain and source renewable power more directly.

Name: Bloomberg LP

Name: BMW Group

Name: Bozzuto Group

Name: Brenntag

Name: BROAD Group

Name: Charles River Laboratories

Name: Citi

Explanation: Citi is the leading global bank, with approximately 200 million customer accounts and business in more than 160 countries, and a mission to responsibly provide financial services that enable growth and economic progress. Name: Commonwealth Bank of Australia

Name: Credit Suisse

Name: Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co.

Name: DBS Bank Ltd
Commitment: DBS has set an interim goal of transferring its Singapore operations to renewable electricity by 2030.

Name: Dell Technologies

Name: Derwent London

Name: Dexus

Name: Diamond Electric Holdings

Name: eBay

Name: Ecolab Inc.

Name: Elion

Name: Etsy

Name: FIA Formula E

Name: Fifth Third Bancorp

Name: Firmenich

The remaining consumption was covered in other markets and will be covered locally when options become available. This is a fundamental step on the company’s journey to ultimately become carbon neutral.

Name: Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer

Name: FUJIFILM Holdings Corporation

Name: Fujikura

Name: Fuyo General Lease Co., Ltd.

Name: Gatwick Airport Limited

Name: General Mills
Commitment: General Mills has committed to source 100% renewable electricity across its entire global operations by 2030.
